fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Culture and media, Competition, Consumers, Culture, Business and Industry, Taxation, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Communication
eu_initiatives: European Electronic Communication Code, e-Privacy Regulation, Copyright, Roaming, Net Neutrality, ...
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership: Telekom Austria AG and its operating companies are inter alia members of ETNO and GSMA.
goals__remit: Telekom Austria AG, which is listed on the Vienna Stock Exchange, is a leading communication provider serving approximately 23 million customers in eight countries in Central and Eastern Europe. The broad portfolio of fixed line and mobile communication products and services includes voice telephony, broadband Internet, multimedia services, IPTV, data and IT services, wholesale and payment services.
relevant_communication:
- Identifying and analyzing the business impact, risks and opportunities that emerge in the policy world. 
- Promoting and representing Telekom Austria‘s views in established industry associations at European level and contribute to achieving better regulations for the telco industry. 
- Working and interfacing with political stakeholders on key issues and offering technical and business related input to political discussions and legislative decision-making processes.
position: Director M&A, International Affairs and Regulation
